metadata.title: Embraer Phenom 300
aws::graph::propositions: Embraer Phenom 300 Cockpit Equipment and Systems
The cockpit of the Embraer Phenom 300 is equipped with three Garmin G1000 12in (305mm) liquid crystal displays.
The three Garmin G1000 displays comprise a pair of flight displays.
The three Garmin G1000 displays include a single central multifunction display.
The Embraer Phenom 300 cockpit has traditional control yokes for the two pilots.
An alphanumeric keypad is used to interact with the flight management system in the Embraer Phenom 300.
The alphanumeric keypad is used to interact with communications radios.
The alphanumeric keypad is used to interact with navigation radios.
The Embraer Phenom 300 is provisioned with a Garmin GFC700 digital three-axis autopilot.
The Garmin GFC700 autopilot has dual-channel "fail passive" functionality.
The Garmin GFC700 autopilot includes roll control.
The Garmin GFC700 autopilot includes pitch control.
The Garmin GFC700 autopilot includes yaw control.
The Garmin GFC700 autopilot features automatic pitch trim.
The Garmin GFC700 autopilot features Mach trim.
The Embraer Phenom 300 uses exclusively a variable bleed air system for anti-icing.
The variable bleed air system heats both horizontal wings.
The anti-icing system permits a safe level of ice to accrete on the vertical stabiliser.
Mix-mode anti-icing measures were avoided to reduce complexity.
Mix-mode anti-icing measures were avoided to reduce potential for confusion.
Electronic flight bags are available as optional equipment for the Embraer Phenom 300.
Later-built examples of the Embraer Phenom 300 are equipped with the Prodigy Touch system.

text: The cockpit of the Phenom 300 is equipped with three Garmin G1000 12in (305mm) liquid crystal displays, comprising a pair of flight displays and a single central multifunction display, along with traditional control yokes for the two pilots. An alphanumeric keypad is used to interact with the flight management system, communications and navigation radios. The aircraft is provisioned a Garmin GFC700 digital three-axis autopilot that has dual-channel "fail passive" functionality with roll, pitch and yaw control as well as automatic pitch trim and Mach trim. To reduce complexity and potential for confusion, mix-mode anti-icing measures were avoided in favour of exclusively using a variable bleed air system to heat both horizontal wings while permitting a safe level of ice to accrete on the vertical stabiliser. Electronic flight bags are available as optional equipment. Later-built examples are equipped with the Prodigy Touch system.
